titles.title: Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Reauthorization Act of 1993
Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Reauthorization Act of 1993
A bill to reauthorize certain programs under the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S13177)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Labor and Human Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Kennedy without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 313.

action.text: The committee substitute as amended agreed to by Voice Vote.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Federal aid to child health services

bill.summary: 11/20/1993--Passed Senate amended. Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Reauthorization Act of 1993 - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize FY 1994 appropriations for primary health services for homeless children. Amends the Stewart B. McKinney Homeless Assistance Act to authorize FY 1994 homeless program appropriations for: (1) community demonstration projects for the mentally ill; (2) adult education; (3) education for homeless children and youth; (4) job training; (5) emergency community services; and (6) family support centers. Revises local educational agency grants for the education of homeless children to eliminate required grant percentages for primary and related activities. Makes the job training for the homeless program permanent.
